title: Rotations in the Plane and Prolog.
abstract: NoRotation is a well-known operation on lists. We define its two-dimensional analogue and discuss its implementation in Prolog using difference lists. An application to the iterative solution of a system of linear equations by the Gauss¿Seidel method is given

Rotation is a well-known operation on lists. We define its two-dimensional analogue and discuss its implementation in Prolog using difference lists. An application to the iterative solution of a system of linear equations by the Gauss¿Seidel method is given.</dc:description><dc:date>
